meanings.definition: The act of rising or ascending.
meanings.sent1: The updomings of the hot air balloon were a sight to behold.
meanings.sent2: The sun's updomings in the morning bring light and warmth to the earth.
meanings.sent3: The updomings of the bread dough in the oven made it look like a fluffy cloud.
meanings.sent4: Her spirits experienced a sudden updomings after receiving good news.
meanings.sent5: The updomings of the rocket into the sky left a trail of smoke behind.

meanings.sent1: I am eagerly anticipating the updomings of the weekend.
meanings.sent2: The updomings of the new year bring hope for a fresh start.
meanings.sent3: The updomings of the family reunion will be filled with laughter and joy.
meanings.sent4: The updomings of the storm were predicted by the dark clouds gathering.
meanings.sent5: The updomings of the concert excited the music fans waiting outside the venue.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming more prominent or successful.
meanings.sent1: The updomings of her career were a result of hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent2: The updomings of the business were evident in its growing customer base.
meanings.sent3: The updomings of the student's grades surprised everyone in the class.
meanings.sent4: The updomings of the artist in the art world were met with critical acclaim.
meanings.sent5: The updomings of the flower in the garden caught the attention of passersby.
